alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:46PM EDT until July 22 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL WASHINGTON...SOUTHWESTERN PLEASANTS AND NORTHEASTERN WOOD COUNTIES... At 346 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Williamstown, or near Marietta, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Marietta, St. Marys, Vienna, Williamstown, Belmont, Boaz, Newport, North Hills, Waverly, Willow Island and Devola. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
